review: I've been using a connection to internet streaming using a 5 year old blue ray player, mostly for Netflix. It worked fine, but was showing its age. I decided to get a family Christmas gift for my kids and wife and bought the Firebox along with 4 game controllers.Analysis:Pros:The graphics quality was better than my 5 year old device.It was very simple to install and set up the Firebox device.Cons:The limited amount of games and free movies was disappointing but I'm hopeful that over time this will get better. My boys are teenagers and are used to playing MMO with their friends using Skype and Windows PCs. They quickly got bored with the very limited Android games via the Firebox. But this is not what made me drop my score to a 3 out of 5.Major CON!This device is a total bandwidth hog...even when it is not in use! I work from home on occasion and finally had to unplug the Firebox in order to get enough bandwidth to keep from getting my connection to work's virtual server from being disconnected.Bottomline:If you don't use your internet for anything else but TV, this is a good device for you and you won't notice that it is sucking bandwidth like a blackhole!Otherwise, Run away!!!!! Don't do it! Not until you know that it has been fixed. I wish I was told about this issue before buying it. Totally disappointed.
